description: A contraction of the English: telephone conference. Or, from the Greek tele- (distance) and conference.

entries.meaning: A telephone conference, an arranged phone call between more than two parties.
examples: The four of us should have a teleconference next week.

entries.meaning: More generally, the live exchange of information among persons and machines remote from one another but linked by a telecommunications system, over telephone, video or other means.

verbs.description: teleconference (third-person singular simple present teleconferences, present participle teleconferencing, simple past and past participle teleconferenced)

entries.meaning: To take part in a teleconference.
examples: I teleconferenced with marketing and engineering.
